metadata.title: CVE-2019-15132 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Zabbix through 4.4.0alpha1 allows User Enumeration. With login requests, itis possible to enumerate application usernames based on the variability ofserver responses (e.g., the "Login name or password is incorrect" and "Nopermissions for system access" messages, or just blocking for a number ofseconds). This affects both api_jsonrpc.php and index.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.2+dfsg-1ubuntu1+esm4').
